summary: The provided documents primarily focus on the Senate Select Committee (SSC) investigation into intelligence activities in the 1970s and do not directly discuss Franklin D. Roosevelt's involvement in the JFK assassination. The documents mention the SSC's inquiries into FBI activities, monitoring of individuals, and responses to committee requests. One document contains a Turkish intelligence report summarizing Finnish reactions to President Kennedy's assassination and initial assessments of Lyndon B. Johnson's succession. However, none of the documents provide any information about Franklin D. Roosevelt or his role in the context of the JFK assassination.
significance: Based on the provided documents, Franklin D. Roosevelt has no significance in the JFK context.
